payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` – FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` – Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` – Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` – Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` – Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` – Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` – Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` – Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` – Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` – End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` – Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.

<user_instructions>

# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` – FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` – Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` – Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` – Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` – Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` – Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` – Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` – Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` – Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` – End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` – Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.


</user_instructions>

Operate autonomously as the WeatherVane super-team. Your goal is to drive the roadmap to completion with world-class engineering, data/ML, product, and design rigor.

Current surprise QA ledger:
- No surprise QA audits recorded yet.

Loop:
1. Read state/roadmap.yaml and choose the highest-priority task(s) not done.
2. Call  to refresh the audit ledger for this session.
3. Run  as a lightweight heartbeat; checkpoint if resource limits appear tight.
4. For each chosen task:
   a. Audit docs/code/tests/design to understand requirements.
   b. Implement the work via fs_read/fs_write/cmd_run (code + tests + docs + design polish). Keep slices small enough to verify quickly.
   c. Run critics_run with ["build","tests","manager_self_check","data_quality","design_system","org_pm","exec_review","health_check","human_sync"] and add allocator/causal/forecast critics when relevant. Use state/critics timestamps/results (including git_sha metadata) to skip suites that have already covered unchanged artifacts this session; rerun when the commit changes or after meaningful edits.
   d. Fix issues. If blocked, log the blocker clearly and mark the task blocked with plan_update.
   e. Record decisions, risks, and next actions via context_write (keep state/context.md <= 1000 words).
   f. Snapshot via context_snapshot.
   g. Update roadmap status with plan_update only after exit criteria are satisfied.
   h. For work expected to run longer than ~5 minutes, queue it with heavy_queue_enqueue (include command/context), monitor via heavy_queue_list, and update status with heavy_queue_update while continuing other work.
5. Prioritise shipping real work over repeated self-review loops while still running critics after meaningful changes land; if nothing changed, move forward instead of re-running the same suites.
6. Approximately once every 100 tasks/messages, deliberately audit a completed roadmap item for hidden gaps or regressions. After each surprise QA, call autopilot_record_audit with task_id/focus/notes and, if issues emerge, open fresh tasks to land fixes before resuming new work.
7. Spread surprise QA audits across different epics/milestones rather than clustering; skip the audit if you already inspected that item in the current session.
8. Repeat on remaining tasks. Stop only when no further progress is possible without human intervention.
Maintain production readiness, enforce ML/causal rigor, polish UX, and communicate like a Staff+/startup leader.
Return JSON summarizing completed tasks, tasks still in progress, blockers, next focus items, and overall notes.

  "content": "\"\"\"Utilities for assembling modelling design matrices from lake snapshots.\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Dict, List\n\nimport polars as pl\nfrom polars import selectors as cs\n\nfrom shared.libs.storage.lake import LakeWriter, read_parquet\nfrom shared.validation.schemas import validate_feature_matrix\nfrom shared.data_context.models import DatasetProfile, build_profile_from_polars\nfrom shared.feature_store.feature_generators import LagRollingFeatureGenerator\n\nREQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS = {\n    \"temp_c\",\n    \"precip_mm\",\n    \"temp_anomaly\",\n    \"precip_anomaly\",\n    \"temp_roll7\",\n    \"precip_roll7\",\n}\n\nTARGET_COLUMN = \"net_revenue\"\n\n\nclass FeatureLeakageError(RuntimeError):\n    \"\"\"Raised when the feature matrix contains potential label leakage.\"\"\"\n\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        tenant_id: str,\n        start: datetime,\n        end: datetime,\n        *,\n        leakage_rows: int,\n        leakage_dates: List[str],\n        forward_rows: int,\n        forward_dates: List[str],\n        forecast_rows: int,\n        forecast_dates: List[str],\n        matrix: \"FeatureMatrix | None\" = None,\n    ) -> None:\n        self.tenant_id = tenant_id\n        self.start = start\n        self.end = end\n        self.leakage_rows = leakage_rows\n        self.leakage_dates = leakage_dates\n        self.forward_rows = forward_rows\n        self.forward_dates = forward_dates\n        self.forecast_rows = forecast_rows\n        self.forecast_dates = forecast_dates\n        self.matrix = matrix\n        summary = (\n            f\"Potential leakage detected for tenant={tenant_id} \"\n            f\"window=[{start.date().isoformat()}, {end.date().isoformat()}]: \"\n            f\"total_rows={leakage_rows}, forward_rows={forward_rows}, forecast_rows={forecast_rows}, \"\n            f\"dates={leakage_dates}\"\n        )\n        super().__init__(summary)\n\n    def as_dict(self) -> Dict[str, List[str] | int | str]:\n        return {\n            \"tenant_id\": self.tenant_id,\n            \"start\": self.start.isoformat(),\n            \"end\": self.end.isoformat(),\n            \"leakage_rows\": self.leakage_rows,\n            \"leakage_dates\": list(self.leakage_dates),\n            \"forward_leakage_rows\": self.forward_rows,\n            \"forward_leakage_dates\": list(self.forward_dates),\n            \"forecast_leakage_rows\": self.forecast_rows,\n            \"forecast_leakage_dates\": list(self.forecast_dates),\n            \"sanitized_rows\": self.matrix.frame.height if self.matrix else None,\n        }\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass FeatureMatrix:\n    frame: pl.DataFrame\n    observed_frame: pl.DataFrame\n    orders_rows: int\n    ads_rows: int\n    promo_rows: int\n    weather_rows: int\n    observed_rows: int\n    latest_observed_date: str | None\n    profiles: Dict[str, DatasetProfile]\n    leakage_risk_rows: int\n    leakage_risk_dates: List[str]\n    forward_leakage_rows: int\n    forward_leakage_dates: List[str]\n    forecast_leakage_rows: int\n    forecast_leakage_dates: List[str]\n\n\nclass FeatureBuilder:\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        lake_root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/raw\"),\n        feature_seed: int = 2024,\n        feature_min_rows: int = 14,\n    ) -> None:\n        self.writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n        self.feature_min_rows = max(feature_min_rows, 1)\n        self.feature_generator = LagRollingFeatureGenerator(\n            LagRollingFeatureGenerator.default_specs(),\n            date_col=\"date\",\n            group_cols=[\"geohash\"],\n            seed=feature_seed,\n        )\n\n    def build(self, tenant_id: str, start: datetime, end: datetime) -> FeatureMatrix:\n        orders = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_shopify_orders\")\n        ads_meta = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_meta_ads\")\n        ads_google = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_google_ads\")\n        promos = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_promos\")\n        weather = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_weather_daily\")\n\n        orders_daily = self._orders_daily(orders)\n        ads_daily = self._ads_daily(ads_meta, ads_google)\n        promos_daily = self._promos_daily(promos)\n        weather_daily = self._weather_daily(weather)\n\n        join_on_geo = (\n            \"geohash\" in orders_daily.columns\n            and \"geohash\" in weather_daily.columns\n            and not orders_daily.get_column(\"geohash\").is_null().all()\n            and not weather_daily.get_column(\"geohash\").is_null().all()\n        )\n\n        if not orders_daily.is_empty():\n            if join_on_geo:\n                frame = orders_daily.join(weather_daily, on=[\"date\", \"geohash\"], how=\"left\")\n            else:\n                frame = orders_daily.join(weather_daily, on=[\"date\"], how=\"left\")\n        else:\n            frame = weather_daily\n\n        if TARGET_COLUMN not in frame.columns:\n            frame = frame.with_columns(pl.lit(None, dtype=pl.Float64).alias(TARGET_COLUMN))\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").cast(pl.Utf8))\n\n        ads_join = ads_daily.drop([col for col in [\"geohash\"] if col in ads_daily.columns])\n        promos_join = promos_daily.drop([col for col in [\"geohash\"] if col in promos_daily.columns])\n\n        frame = frame.join(ads_join, on=\"date\", how=\"full\", suffix=\"_ads\")\n        if \"date_ads\" in frame.columns:\n            frame = (\n                frame.with_columns(\n                    pl.when(pl.col(\"date\").is_null())\n                    .then(pl.col(\"date_ads\"))\n                    .otherwise(pl.col(\"date\"))\n                    .alias(\"date\")\n                )\n                .drop(\"date_ads\")\n            )\n        frame = frame.join(promos_join, on=\"date\", how=\"full\", suffix=\"_promo\")\n        if \"date_promo\" in frame.columns:\n            frame = (\n                frame.with_columns(\n                    pl.when(pl.col(\"date\").is_null())\n                    .then(pl.col(\"date_promo\"))\n                    .otherwise(pl.col(\"date\"))\n                    .alias(\"date\")\n                )\n                .drop(\"date_promo\")\n            )\n        frame = frame.sort(\"date\")\n        start_str = start.date().isoformat()\n        end_str = end.date().isoformat()\n        frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"date\").is_between(pl.lit(start_str), pl.lit(end_str)))\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            pl.col(TARGET_COLUMN).is_not_null().alias(\"target_available\"),\n        )\n\n        if frame.width > 0:\n            frame = frame.with_columns(cs.numeric().fill_null(0))\n\n        forward_looking_columns = [\n            column\n            for column in frame.columns\n            if column.endswith(\"_spend\")\n            or column.endswith(\"_conversions\")\n            or column == \"promos_sent\"\n        ]\n        forward_signal_expr = (\n            pl.lit(False)\n            if not forward_looking_columns\n            else pl.any_horizontal(\n                [\n                    pl.col(column).cast(pl.Float64).fill_null(0.0).abs() > 0.0\n                    for column in forward_looking_columns\n                ]\n            )\n        )\n        forward_leakage_expr = (~pl.col(\"target_available\")) & forward_signal_expr\n        forecast_leakage_expr = (\n            pl.col(\"observation_type\")\n            .cast(pl.Utf8)\n            .str.to_lowercase()\n            .eq(\"forecast\")\n            & pl.col(\"target_available\")\n            if \"observation_type\" in frame.columns\n            else pl.lit(False)\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            [\n                forward_leakage_expr.alias(\"_forward_leakage\"),\n                forecast_leakage_expr.alias(\"_forecast_leakage\"),\n            ]\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            (pl.col(\"_forward_leakage\") | pl.col(\"_forecast_leakage\")).alias(\"leakage_risk\")\n        )\n\n        forward_leakage_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"_forward_leakage\"))\n        forward_leakage_rows = int(forward_leakage_frame.height)\n        forward_leakage_dates = (\n            forward_leakage_frame.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if forward_leakage_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        forecast_leakage_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"_forecast_leakage\"))\n        forecast_leakage_rows = int(forecast_leakage_frame.height)\n        forecast_leakage_dates = (\n            forecast_leakage_frame.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if forecast_leakage_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        frame = frame.drop([\"_forward_leakage\", \"_forecast_leakage\"])\n\n        missing = [col for col in REQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS if col not in frame.columns]\n        if missing:\n            raise ValueError(f\"Weather features missing from matrix: {missing}\")\n\n        validate_feature_matrix(frame)\n        profiles: Dict[str, DatasetProfile] = {}\n        try:\n            profiles[\"orders\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"orders\", orders)\n            ads_combined = pl.concat([df for df in (ads_meta, ads_google) if not df.is_empty()], how=\"vertical\") if (not ads_meta.is_empty() or not ads_google.is_empty()) else pl.DataFrame([])\n            profiles[\"ads\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"ads\", ads_combined)\n            profiles[\"promos\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"promos\", promos)\n            profiles[\"weather\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"weather\", weather)\n        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - profiling is best-effort\n            profiles = {}\n\n        leakage_rows = frame.filter(pl.col(\"leakage_risk\"))\n        leakage_risk_rows = int(leakage_rows.height)\n        leakage_risk_dates = (\n            leakage_rows.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if leakage_risk_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        frame = frame.filter(~pl.col(\"leakage_risk\")) if leakage_risk_rows > 0 else frame\n        if frame.height >= self.feature_min_rows:\n            frame = self.feature_generator.transform(frame)\n        observed_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"target_available\"))\n        observed_rows = int(observed_frame.height)\n        max_observed_date = observed_frame[\"date\"].max() if observed_rows > 0 else None\n        latest_observed_date = str(max_observed_date) if isinstance(max_observed_date, str) else max_observed_date\n        matrix = FeatureMatrix(\n            frame=frame,\n            observed_frame=observed_frame,\n            orders_rows=int(orders.height),\n            ads_rows=int(ads_meta.height + ads_google.height),\n            promo_rows=int(promos.height),\n            weather_rows=int(weather.height),\n            observed_rows=observed_rows,\n            latest_observed_date=latest_observed_date,\n            profiles=profiles,\n            leakage_risk_rows=leakage_risk_rows,\n            leakage_risk_dates=[str(date) for date in leakage_risk_dates],\n            forward_leakage_rows=forward_leakage_rows,\n            forward_leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in forward_leakage_dates],\n            forecast_leakage_rows=forecast_leakage_rows,\n            forecast_leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in forecast_leakage_dates],\n        )\n        if leakage_risk_rows > 0:\n            raise FeatureLeakageError(\n                tenant_id,\n                start,\n                end,\n            leakage_rows=leakage_risk_rows,\n                leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in leakage_risk_dates],\n                forward_rows=forward_leakage_rows,\n                forward_dates=matrix.forward_leakage_dates,\n                forecast_rows=forecast_leakage_rows,\n                forecast_dates=matrix.forecast_leakage_dates,\n                matrix=matrix,\n            )\n        return matrix\n\n    def _load_latest(self, dataset: str) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        path = self.writer.latest(dataset)\n        if not path:\n            return pl.DataFrame([])\n        return read_parquet(path)\n\n    def _orders_daily(self, orders: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if orders.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\"date\": [], \"geohash\": [], \"net_revenue\": []})\n        if \"created_at\" not in orders.columns:\n            raise ValueError(\"orders dataset missing `created_at`\")\n        frame = orders.with_columns([\n            pl.col(\"created_at\").str.slice(0, 10).alias(\"date\"),\n            pl.col(\"ship_geohash\").alias(\"geohash\"),\n        ])\n        group_cols = [\"date\", \"geohash\"] if \"ship_geohash\" in orders.columns else [\"date\"]\n        return frame.group_by(group_cols).agg(pl.col(\"net_revenue\").sum())\n\n    def _ads_daily(self, meta: pl.DataFrame, google: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        frames = []\n        if not meta.is_empty():\n            frames.append(\n                meta.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").alias(\"date\"))\n                .group_by(\"date\")\n                .agg([\n                    pl.col(\"spend\").sum().alias(\"meta_spend\"),\n                    pl.col(\"conversions\").sum().alias(\"meta_conversions\"),\n                ])\n                .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n            )\n        if not google.is_empty():\n            frames.append(\n                google.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").alias(\"date\"))\n                .group_by(\"date\")\n                .agg([\n                    pl.col(\"spend\").sum().alias(\"google_spend\"),\n                    pl.col(\"conversions\").sum().alias(\"google_conversions\"),\n                ])\n                .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n            )\n        if not frames:\n            return pl.DataFrame({\n                \"date\": [],\n                \"geohash\": [],\n                \"meta_spend\": [],\n                \"meta_conversions\": [],\n                \"google_spend\": [],\n                \"google_conversions\": [],\n            })\n        return (\n            pl.concat(frames, how=\"align\")\n            .group_by(\"date\")\n            .agg([\n                pl.col(\"meta_spend\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"meta_conversions\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"google_spend\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"google_conversions\").sum(),\n            ])\n            .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n        )\n\n    def _promos_daily(self, promos: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if promos.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\"date\": [], \"geohash\": [], \"promos_sent\": []})\n        col = \"send_date\" if \"send_date\" in promos.columns else \"scheduled_at\"\n        return (\n            promos\n            .with_columns(pl.col(col).str.slice(0, 10).alias(\"date\"))\n            .group_by(\"date\")\n            .agg(pl.len().alias(\"promos_sent\"))\n            .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n        )\n\n    def _weather_daily(self, weather: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if weather.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\n                \"date\": [],\n                \"geohash\": [],\n                \"temp_c\": [],\n                \"precip_mm\": [],\n                \"temp_anomaly\": [],\n                \"precip_anomaly\": [],\n                \"temp_roll7\": [],\n                \"precip_roll7\": [],\n            })\n        missing = REQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS - set(weather.columns)\n        if missing:\n            raise ValueError(f\"Weather dataset missing columns: {missing}\")\n        frame = weather.with_columns(\n            pl.col(\"date\").str.strptime(pl.Date, strict=False).alias(\"date\"),\n        )\n        frame = frame.sort([\"geohash\", \"date\"])\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"temp_roll7\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"precip_roll7\"),\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").cast(pl.Utf8))\n        return frame\n"
}

{
  "path": "shared/feature_store/feature_generators.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Feature engineering utilities for WeatherVane feature store.\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass, field\nfrom typing import Iterable, List, Sequence\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nNUMERIC_DTYPES = {\n    pl.Int8,\n    pl.Int16,\n    pl.Int32,\n    pl.Int64,\n    pl.UInt8,\n    pl.UInt16,\n    pl.UInt32,\n    pl.UInt64,\n    pl.Float32,\n    pl.Float64,\n}\n\n\ndef _is_numeric_dtype(dtype: pl.DataType) -> bool:\n    try:\n        return dtype in NUMERIC_DTYPES\n    except TypeError:\n        return False\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass LagRollingSpec:\n    \"\"\"Configuration describing lag and rolling window features for one column.\"\"\"\n\n    column: str\n    lags: Sequence[int] = field(default_factory=lambda: (1,))\n    rolling_windows: Sequence[int] = field(default_factory=lambda: (7,))\n    rolling_stat: str = \"mean\"\n    alias_prefix: str | None = None\n\n    def feature_name(self, kind: str, value: int) -> str:\n        base = self.alias_prefix or self.column\n        return f\"{base}_{kind}{value}\"\n\n\nclass LagRollingFeatureGenerator:\n    \"\"\"Generate lagged and rolling window features with deterministic ordering.\"\"\"\n\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        specs: Iterable[LagRollingSpec],\n        *,\n        date_col: str = \"date\",\n        group_cols: Sequence[str] | None = None,\n        seed: int = 42,\n        min_periods: int = 1,\n    ) -> None:\n        self.specs: List[LagRollingSpec] = list(specs)\n        self.date_col = date_col\n        self.group_cols = list(group_cols or [])\n        self.seed = int(seed)\n        self.min_periods = max(1, int(min_periods))\n\n    def transform(self, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        \"\"\"Return a new frame including lag/rolling features.\"\"\"\n\n        if frame.is_empty() or not self.specs:\n            return frame\n\n        if self.date_col not in frame.columns:\n            raise KeyError(f\"Expected date column `{self.date_col}` in feature matrix\")\n\n        working = frame.clone()\n        working = working.with_columns(\n            pl.arange(0, pl.len(), eager=False).alias(\"__wvo_row_nr\")\n        )\n\n        try:\n            working = working.with_columns(\n                pl.col(self.date_col)\n                .str.strptime(pl.Date, strict=False)\n                .alias(\"__wvo_date\"),\n            )\n        except pl.exceptions.InvalidOperationError:\n            working = working.with_columns(\n                pl.col(self.date_col).cast(pl.Date, strict=False).alias(\"__wvo_date\"),\n            )\n\n        order_cols = [col for col in self.group_cols if col in working.columns]\n        seed_rank = np.random.default_rng(self.seed).random(working.height)\n        working = working.with_columns(\n            pl.Series(\"__wvo_seed_rank\", seed_rank.tolist())\n        )\n        order_cols.extend([\"__wvo_date\", \"__wvo_seed_rank\", \"__wvo_row_nr\"])\n        working = working.sort(order_cols)\n\n        over_cols = [col for col in self.group_cols if col in working.columns]\n        expressions: List[pl.Expr] = []\n\n        for spec in self.specs:\n            if spec.column not in working.columns:\n                continue\n            dtype = working.schema[spec.column]\n            if not _is_numeric_dtype(dtype):\n                continue\n\n            base_expr = pl.col(spec.column)\n            for lag in spec.lags:\n                if lag <= 0:\n                    continue\n                lag_expr = base_expr.shift(lag)\n                if over_cols:\n                    lag_expr = lag_expr.over(over_cols)\n                expressions.append(lag_expr.alias(spec.feature_name(\"lag\", lag)))\n\n            for window in spec.rolling_windows:\n                if window <= 0:\n                    continue\n                stat = spec.rolling_stat.lower()\n                if stat == \"sum\":\n                    roll_expr = base_expr.rolling_sum(\n                        window_size=window, min_samples=self.min_periods\n                    )\n                elif stat == \"std\":\n                    roll_expr = base_expr.rolling_std(\n                        window_size=window, min_samples=max(self.min_periods, 2)\n                    )\n                else:\n                    roll_expr = base_expr.rolling_mean(\n                        window_size=window, min_samples=self.min_periods\n                    )\n                if over_cols:\n                    roll_expr = roll_expr.over(over_cols)\n                expressions.append(roll_expr.alias(spec.feature_name(\"roll\", window)))\n\n        if expressions:\n            working = working.with_columns(expressions)\n\n        return working.drop(\n            [\"__wvo_seed_rank\", \"__wvo_date\", \"__wvo_row_nr\"]\n        )\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def default_specs() -> List[LagRollingSpec]:\n        \"\"\"Default configuration used by the feature builder.\"\"\"\n\n        return [\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"net_revenue\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"meta_spend\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"sum\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"google_spend\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"sum\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"meta_conversions\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"google_conversions\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"promos_sent\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"sum\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"temp_c\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"precip_mm\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"temp_anomaly\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n                alias_prefix=\"temp_anom\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"precip_anomaly\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n                alias_prefix=\"precip_anom\",\n            ),\n        ]\n"
}

 generator_seed_7 = LagRollingFeatureGenerator(\n        [spec], date_col=\"date\", group_cols=[\"geohash\"], seed=7\n    )\n    generator_seed_7_again = LagRollingFeatureGenerator(\n        [spec], shared.libs.storage.lake import LakeWriter\nfrom shared.libs.storage.state import JsonStateStore\n\nDEFAULT_LOOKBACK_DAYS = 30\nFALLBACK_COORDINATES = (37.7749, -122.4194)\nGEOCODE_RATIO_FLOOR = 0.7\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass IngestionContext:\n    tenant_id: str\n    start_date: datetime\n    end_date: datetime\n\n\ndef _resolve_window(\n    store: JsonStateStore,\n    tenant_id: str,\n  path = None\n    source = None\n\n    if summary is None:\n        status = \"missing\"\n        issues.append(\"ingestor_not_configured\")\n    else:\n        row_count = summary.row_count\n \"total_price\": 0.0,\n                \"subtotal_price\": 0.0,\n                \"total_tax\": 0.0,\n                \"total_discounts\": 0.0,\n                \"shipping_postal_code\": \"00000\",\n \"ship_geohash\": geohash,\n            }\n        ]\n        orders_path = writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_shopify_orders\", orders_payload)\n        orders_summary = IngestionSummary(\n   products_summary = IngestionSummary(\n            path=str(products_path),\n            row_count=len(products_payload),\n            source=\"stub\",\n        )\n        source = \"stub\"\n\n    store.save(\n        \"ingestion\",\n        f\"{context.tenant_id}_shopify\",\n        {\n            \"last_start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"last_end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            \"orders_path\": orders_summary.path,\n            \"orders_row_count\": orders_summary.row_count,\n            \"products_path\": products_summary.path,\n }\n\n\nasync def ingest_ads(\n    context: IngestionContext,\n    lake_root: str,\n    state_root: str,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    store = google_summary = IngestionSummary(path=str(google_path), row_count=len(google_payload), source=\"stub\")\n        source = \"stub\"\n    else:\n        source = \"ads_api\"\n\n    store.save(\n \"meta_path\": meta_summary.path if meta_summary else None,\n            \"meta_rows\": meta_summary.row_count if meta_summary else 0,\n            \"google_path\": google_summary.path if google_summary else None,\n            \"google_rows\": google_summary.row_count if google_summary else 0,\n            \"source\": source,\n            \"updated_at\": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n        },\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"meta\": meta_summary,\n        \"google\": google_summary,\n        \"source\": source,\n    }\n\n\nasync def \"send_date\": context.start_date.date().isoformat(),\n                \"discount_pct\": 0.0,\n            }\n        ]\n        promo_path = writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_promos\", promo_payload)\n        summary = IngestionSummary(path=str(promo_path), row_count=len(promo_payload), source=\"stub\")\n        source = \"stub\"\n    else:\n        source = \"klaviyo_api\"\n\n    store.save(\n        \"ingestion\",\n        f\"{context.tenant_id}_promo\",\n        {\n            \"last_start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"last_end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            \"promo_path\": summary.path,\n            \"promo_rows\": summary.row_count,\n            \"source\": source,\n            \"updated_at\": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n        },\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"promo\": summary,\n        \"source\": source,\n    }\n\n\ndef assemble_dq_report(\n    context: IngestionContext,\n    shopify_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    ads_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    promo_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    datasets = {\n        \"shopify_orders\": _evaluate_dataset(\"shopify_orders\", shopify_payload.get(\"orders\")),\n        \"shopify_products\": _evaluate_dataset(\"shopify_products\", shopify_payload.get(\"products\")),\n        \"meta_ads\": _evaluate_dataset(\"meta_ads\", ads_payload.get(\"meta\")),\n        \"google_ads\": _evaluate_dataset(\"google_ads\", ads_payload.get(\"google\")),\n        \"promos\": _evaluate_dataset(\"promos\", promo_payload.get(\"promo\")),\n    }\n\n    return {\n        \"tenant_id\": context.tenant_id,\n        \"generated_at\": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n        \"window\": {\n            \"start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n        },\n        \"datasets\": datasets,\n        \"sources\": {\n            \"shopify\": shopify_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"ads\": ads_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"promo\": promo_payload.get(\"source\"),\n        },\n    }\n\n\n@flow(name=\"weathervane-ingestion\")\nasync def orchestrate_ingestion_flow(\n    tenant_id: str,\n    start_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n    end_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n    *,\n    lake_root: str | Path | None = None,\n    state_root: str | Path | None = None,\n    dq_report_path: str | Path | None = None,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    resolved_lake_root = str(lake_root or Path(\"storage/lake/raw\"))\n    resolved_state_root = str(state_root or Path(\"storage/metadata/state\"))\n    resolved_report_path = Path(dq_report_path or Path(\"experiments/ingest/dq_report.json\"))\n\n    store = JsonStateStore(root=resolved_state_root)\n    context = _resolve_window(store, tenant_id, start_date, end_date)\n\n    logger.info(\n        \"Starting ingestion flow for tenant %s between %s and %s\",\n        tenant_id,\n        context.start_date.isoformat(),\n        context.end_date.isoformat(),\n    )\n\n    shopify_payload = await store.save(\n        \"ingestion\",\n        f\"{tenant_id}_window\",\n        {\n            \"last_start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"last_end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n %s; data quality report at %s\",\n        tenant_id,\n        resolved_report_path,\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"window\": dq_report[\"window\"],\n        \"datasets\": dq_report[\"datasets\"],\n   },\n    }\n"

{\"ship_latitude\", \"ship_longitude\"}.issubset(frame.columns):\n        coord_frame = (\n            frame.select([\"ship_latitude\", \"ship_longitude\"])\n            .drop_nulls()\n            .unique()\n            .head(COORDINATE_LIMIT)\n        )\n        coords.extend((float(lat), float(lon)) for lat, lon in coord_frame.iter_rows())\n\n    if len(coords) < COORDINATE_LIMIT and unique_coords.append((lat, lon))\n\n    return unique_coords\n\n\ndef _confidence_from_metrics(metrics: Dict[str, Any]) -> ConfidenceLevel:\n    holdout_r2 = float(metrics.get(\"holdout_r2\") or \"\"\"Approximate risk-aversion weight from model diagnostics.\"\"\"\n\n    holdout_r2 = float(metrics.get(\"holdout_r2\") or 0.0)\n    if holdout_r2 >= 0.6:\n        return 0.15\n    if holdout_r2 >= 15.0,\n                        \"temp_max_c\": 16.0,\n                        \"temp_min_c\": 14.0,\n                        \"apparent_temp_c\": 15.0,\n                        \"precip_mm\": 0.5,\n                        \"precip_probability\": 0.2,\n                        \"humidity_mean\": 0.5,\n                        \"windspeed_max\": 10.0,\n                        \"uv_index_max\": 3.0,\n                        \"snowfall_mm\": 0.0,\n                        \"temp_anomaly\": 0.0,\n                        \"precip_anomaly\": 0.0,\n                        \"temp_roll7\": 15.0,\n                        \"precip_roll7\": 0.5,\n                        \"temp_c_lag1\": None,\n                        \"precip_mm_lag1\": None,\n                        \"uv_index_lag1\": None,\n          \"snow_event_flag\": 0,\n                        \"high_wind_flag\": 0,\n                        \"uv_alert_flag\": 0,\n                        \"high_precip_prob_flag\": 0,\n                        \"observation_type\": \"observed\" if current <= end_date else \"forecast\",\n                        \"as_of_utc\": datetime.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=timezone.utc).isoformat(),\n                    }\n                )\n\n    if rows:\n        df = pl.DataFrame(rows).unique(subset=[\"date\", \"geohash\", \"observation_type\"])\n        df = df.sort([\"date\", \"geohash\", \"weather_path\": str(path),\n        \"rows\": rows,\n        \"cells\": list(sources.keys()),\n        \"sources\": sources,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Build feature matrix\")\nasync def   }\n        matrix = exc.matrix\n        if matrix is None:\n            raise\n        logger.warning(\n            \"Feature leakage guardrail triggered for tenant %s; sanitized %d rows\",\n \"observed_design_matrix\": matrix.observed_frame.to_dict(as_series=False),\n        \"metadata\": {\n            \"start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            \"orders_rows\": matrix.orders_rows,\n            \"ads_rows\": matrix.ads_rows,\n            \"promo_rows\": matrix.promo_rows,\n            \"weather_rows\": matrix.weather_rows,\n            \"observed_rows\": matrix.observed_rows,\n            \"latest_observed_target_date\": matrix.latest_observed_date,\n            \"leakage_guardrail\": {\n                \"target_available_column\": \"target_available\",\n                \"observed_rows\": matrix.observed_rows,\n                \"total_rows\": int(matrix.frame.height),\n                \"leakage_risk_rows\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows,\n                \"leakage_risk_dates\": matrix.leakage_risk_dates,\n                \"forward_leakage_rows\": matrix.forward_leakage_rows,\n                \"forward_leakage_dates\": matrix.forward_leakage_dates,\n                \"forecast_leakage_rows\": matrix.forecast_leakage_rows,\n                \"forecast_leakage_dates\": matrix.forecast_leakage_dates,\n                \"passes\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows == 0,\n                \"status\": guardrail_status,\n                **guardrail_notes,\n            },\n            \"shopify_summary\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"ads_summary\": ads_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"promo_summary\": promo_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"weather_row_count\": len(weather_payload.get(\"rows\", [])),\n        },\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Fit models\")\nasync def fit_models(feature_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Fitting baseline + MMM models for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    observed_matrix_dict = feature_payload.get(\"observed_design_matrix\")\n    matrix_dict = observed_matrix_dict if observed_matrix_dict is not None else (feature_payload.get(\"design_matrix\") or {})\n    bundle = train_poc_models(matrix_dict)\n\n    return {\n        \"models\": {\n            \"baseline\": {\n                \"coefficients\": bundle.baseline.coefficients,\n                \"intercept\": bundle.baseline.intercept,\n                \"features\": bundle.baseline.features,\n            },\n            \"mmm\": {\n                \"base_roas\": bundle.mmm.base_roas,\n                \"elasticity\": bundle.mmm.elasticity,\n                \"mean_roas\": bundle.mmm.mean_roas,\n                \"mean_spend\": bundle.mmm.mean_spend,\n                \"features\": bundle.mmm.features,\n            },\n            \"timeseries\": {\n                \"features\": bundle.timeseries.features if bundle.timeseries else [],\n                \"target\": bundle.timeseries.target if bundle.timeseries else \"net_revenue\",\n                \"holdout_r2\": bundle.timeseries.holdout_r2 if bundle.timeseries else 0.0,\n                \"cv_scores\": bundle.timeseries.cv_scores if bundle.timeseries else [],\n            },\n        },\n        \"metrics\": bundle.diagnostics,\n        \"quantiles\": bundle.quantiles,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Simulate counterfactuals\")\nasync def simulate_counterfactuals(\n    model_payload: Dict[str, Any], feature_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Simulating counterfactual allocations for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    frame_dict = feature_payload.get(\"design_matrix\") or {}\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(frame_dict)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return {\"cells\": [], \"total_budget\": 0.0, \"status\": \"DEGRADED\"}\n\n    latest = frame.tail(1)\n    spend_cols = [col for col in frame.columns if col.endswith(\"_spend\")]\n    current_spend = {col.replace(\"_spend\", \"\"): float(latest[0, col]) for col in spend_cols}\n    total_budget = sum(current_spend.values())\n\n    mmm_payload = model_payload.get(\"models\", {}).get(\"mmm\", {})\n    mean_roas_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"mean_roas\", {}) or {}\n    mean_spend_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"mean_spend\", {}) or {}\n    elasticity_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"elasticity\", {}) or {}\n    base_roas = float(mmm_payload.get(\"base_roas\", 1.0))\n\n    guardrails = Guardrails(\n        min_spend=0.0,\n        max_spend=max(current_spend.values() or [0.0]) * 1.5 + 1e-6,\n        roas_floor=0.5,\n        learning_cap=0.25,\n    )\n\n    if guardrails.max_spend < guardrails.min_spend:\n        guardrails.max_spend = guardrails.min_spend\n\n    def _roas_for(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        feature = f\"{cell}_spend\"\n        base = float(mean_roas_lookup.get(feature, base_roas))\n        mean_spend_val = float(mean_spend_lookup.get(feature, current_spend.get(cell, 0.0) or guardrails.min_spend or 1.0))\n        elasticity = float(elasticity_lookup.get(feature, 0.0))\n        if mean_spend_val <= 0:\n            return max(base, 0.0)\n        ratio = (spend - mean_spend_val) / max(mean_spend_val, 1e-6)\n        roas = base + elasticity * ratio\n        if not np.isfinite(roas):  # type: ignore[attr-defined]\n            roas = base\n        return max(roas, 0.0)\n\n    roi_curves: Dict[str, List[Dict[str, float]]] = {}\n    expected_roas: Dict[str, float] = {}\n\n    for cell, spend in current_spend.items():\n        candidates = {\n            0.0,\n            guardrails.min_spend,\n            guardrails.max_spend,\n            spend,\n            spend * 0.5,\n            spend * 0.75,\n            spend * 1.25,\n            spend * 1.5,\n        }\n        sanitized: List[float] = []\n        for value in candidates:\n            if value < 0:\n                continue\n            capped = min(max(value, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.max_spend)\n            sanitized.append(round(capped, 6))\n        sanitized = sorted(set(sanitized))\n        if not sanitized or sanitized[0] > 0.0:\n            sanitized.insert(0, 0.0)\n\n        curve_points: List[Dict[str, float]] = []\n        for candidate in sanitized:\n            roas = _roas_for(cell, candidate)\n            curve_points.append({\n                \"spend\": candidate,\n                \"roas\": roas,\n                \"revenue\": roas * candidate,\n            })\n        roi_curves[cell] = curve_points\n\n        baseline_spend = spend if spend > 0 else max(guardrails.min_spend, 1.0)\n        expected_roas[cell] = max(_roas_for(cell, baseline_spend), 0.1)\n\n    return {\n        \"cells\": list(current_spend.keys()),\n        \"total_budget\": total_budget,\n        \"current_spend\": current_spend,\n        \"expected_roas\": expected_roas,\n        \"guardrails\": guardrails,\n        \"metrics\": model_payload.get(\"metrics\", {}),\n        \"roi_curves\": roi_curves,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Allocate budgets\")\nasync def allocate_budget(\n    model_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    simulation_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    context: TenantContext,\n    context_tags: Optional[List[str]] = None,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Optimising budget allocation for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    cells = simulation_payload.get(\"cells\", [])\n    if not cells:\n        return {\"plan\": [], \"guardrails\": {}, \"status\": \"DEGRADED\"}\n\n    quantiles = model_payload.get(\"quantiles\", {}).get(\"expected_revenue\", {}) or {}\n    metrics = model_payload.get(\"metrics\", {})\n    allocation = allocate(\n        AllocationInput(\n            cells=cells,\n            total_budget=float(simulation_payload.get(\"total_budget\", 0.0)),\n            current_spend=simulation_payload.get(\"current_spend\", {}),\n            expected_roas=simulation_payload.get(\"expected_roas\", {}),\n            roi_curves=simulation_payload.get(\"roi_curves\", {}),\n            guardrails=simulation_payload.get(\"guardrails\"),\n            context_tags=context_tags or [],\n            quantile_factors=quantiles,\n            risk_aversion=_risk_from_metrics(metrics),\n        )\n    )\n    confidence = _confidence_from_metrics(metrics)\n    confidence_value = confidence.value\n\n    roi_curves = simulation_payload.get(\"roi_curves\", {})\n    expected_roas_lookup = simulation_payload.get(\"expected_roas\", {})\n\n    def _interp(points: List[Dict[str, float]], spend: float, key: str) -> float:\n        sorted_points = sorted(points, key=lambda entry: entry.get(\"spend\", 0.0))\n        if not sorted_points:\n            return 0.0\n        if spend <= sorted_points[0][\"spend\"]:\n            first = sorted_points[0]\n            if len(sorted_points) == 1:\n                return float(first.get(key, 0.0))\n            second = sorted_points[1]\n            span = second[\"spend\"] - first[\"spend\"]\n            if span == 0:\n                return float(first.get(key, 0.0))\n            weight = (spend - first[\"spend\"]) / span\n            return float(first.get(key, 0.0) + weight * (second.get(key, 0.0) - first.get(key, 0.0)))\n\n        for idx in range(1, len(sorted_points)):\n            prev = sorted_points[idx - 1]\n            curr = sorted_points[idx]\n            if spend <= curr[\"spend\"]:\n                span = curr[\"spend\"] - prev[\"spend\"]\n                if span == 0:\n                    return float(curr.get(key, prev.get(key, 0.0)))\n                weight = (spend - prev[\"spend\"]) / span\n                return float(prev.get(key, 0.0) + weight * (curr.get(key, 0.0) - prev.get(key, 0.0)))\n\n        last = sorted_points[-1]\n        if len(sorted_points) == 1:\n            return float(last.get(key, 0.0))\n        prev = sorted_points[-2]\n        span = last[\"spend\"] - prev[\"spend\"]\n        slope = (last.get(key, 0.0) - prev.get(key, 0.0)) / span if span else 0.0\n        return float(last.get(key, 0.0) + slope * (spend - last[\"spend\"]))\n\n    def _revenue_from_curve(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        points = roi_curves.get(cell)\n        if not points:\n            return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0) * spend\n        return _interp(points, spend, \"revenue\")\n\n    def _roas_from_curve(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        points = roi_curves.get(cell)\n        if not points:\n            return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0)\n        roas = _interp(points, spend, \"roas\")\n        if spend > 0:\n            return max(roas, 0.0)\n        return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0)\n\n    slices = []\n    for cell, spend in allocation.spends.items():\n        revenue_mid = _revenue_from_curve(cell, spend)\n        p50_factor = quantiles.get(\"p50\") or 1.0\n        if p50_factor <= 0:\n            p50_factor = 1.0\n        scale = revenue_mid / p50_factor if p50_factor else revenue_mid\n        revenue_p10 = max(0.0, (quantiles.get(\"p10\") or p50_factor) * scale)\n        revenue_p50 = max(0.0, p50_factor * scale)\n        revenue_p90 = max(0.0, (quantiles.get(\"p90\") or p50_factor) * scale)\n        roas_quantiles = {\n            \"p10\": revenue_p10 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n            \"p50\": revenue_p50 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n            \"p90\": revenue_p90 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n        }\n        slices.append(\n            {\n                \"cell\": cell,\n                \"recommended_spend\": spend,\n                \"expected_revenue\": {\n                    \"p10\": revenue_p10,\n                    \"p50\": revenue_p50,\n                    \"p90\": revenue_p90,\n                },\n                \"expected_roas\": roas_quantiles,\n                \"confidence\": confidence_value,\n                \"assumptions\": [\"Spend change <=25%\", \"ROAS floor 0.5\"],\n                \"rationale\": {\n                    \"primary_driver\": \"Weather & elasticity uplift\",\n                    \"supporting_factors\": [f\"Holdout R²: {metrics.get('holdout_r2', 0.0):.2f}\"],\n                    \"confidence_level\": confidence_value,\n                    \"data_quality\": \"FULL\" if metrics.get('row_count', 0) > 0 else \"DEGRADED\",\n                    \"assumptions\": [\"Quantile scaling\"],\n                    \"risks\": [\"Forecast error\", \"Inventory limits\"],\n                },\n                \"status\": \"FULL\" if allocation.diagnostics.get(\"success\") else \"DEGRADED\",\n            }\n        )\n\n    validate_plan_slices(slices)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"confidence\"] = confidence_value\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"mae\"] = float(metrics.get(\"mae\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"rmse\"] = float(metrics.get(\"rmse\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"bias\"] = float(metrics.get(\"bias\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"prediction_std\"] = float(metrics.get(\"prediction_std\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"quantile_width\"] = float(metrics.get(\"quantile_width\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    return {\n        \"plan\": slices,\n        \"guardrails\": allocation.diagnostics,\n        \"status\": \"FULL\" if allocation.diagnostics.get(\"success\") else \"DEGRADED\",\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Generate PoC report\")\nasync def generate_poc_report(plan_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Rendering PoC report for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n    return {\"report_path\": f\"poc_reports/{context.tenant_id}/latest\"}\n\n\n@flow(name=\"weathervane-poc-pipeline\")\nasync def orchestrate_poc_flow(\n    tenant_id: str,\n    start_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n    end_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"Run the end-to-end Plan & Proof pipeline for a tenant in read-only mode.\"\"\"\n\n    if end_date is None:\n        end_date = datetime.utcnow()\n    if start_date is None:\n        start_date = end_date - timedelta(days=DEFAULT_LOOKBACK_DAYS)\n\n    context = TenantContext(tenant_id=tenant_id, start_date=start_date, end_date=end_date)\n\n    lake_root = os.getenv(\"STORAGE_LAKE_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/raw\")\n    weather_root = os.getenv(\"STORAGE_WEATHER_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/weather\")\n\n    shopify_payload = await fetch_shopify_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    ads_payload = await fetch_ads_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    promo_payload = await fetch_promo_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    incrementality_design = await design_geo_incrementality_experiment(shopify_payload, context)\n    weather_payload = await fetch_weather_data(\n        context,\n        shopify_payload,\n        cache_root=weather_root,\n        lake_root=lake_root,\n    )\n    weather_source = _derive_weather_source(weather_payload)\n    features = await build_feature_matrix(shopify_payload, ads_payload, promo_payload, weather_payload, context, lake_root=lake_root)\n\n    tag_metadata = {\n        \"weather_source\": weather_source,\n        \"dataset_rows\": {\n            \"orders\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"orders_rows\"),\n            \"ads\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"ads_rows\"),\n            \"promos\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"promo_rows\"),\n            \"weather\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"weather_row_count\"),\n        },\n        \"orders_geocoded_ratio\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}).get(\"orders_geocoded_ratio\"),\n        \"incrementality_design\": incrementality_design,\n    }\n\n    context_tags = default_context_service.derive_tags(context.tenant_id, tag_metadata)\n\n    models = await fit_models(features, context)\n    simulations = await simulate_counterfactuals(models, features, context)\n    plan = await allocate_budget(models, simulations, context, context_tags=context_tags)\n    report = await generate_poc_report(plan, context)\n\n    context_snapshot = default_context_service.snapshot(\n        context.tenant_id,\n        metadata={\n            \"window\": {\n                \"start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n                \"end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            },\n            **tag_metadata,\n        },\n    )\n\n    geocoding_validation = evaluate_geocoding_coverage(\n        context.tenant_id,\n        lake_root=lake_root,\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"context\": context,\n        \"plan\": plan,\n        \"report\": report,\n        \"data_context\": context_snapshot.to_dict(),\n        \"geocoding_validation\": geocoding_validation.to_dict(),\n        \"shopify_summary\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"ads_summary\": ads_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"promo_summary\": promo_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"sources\": {\n            \"shopify\": shopify_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"ads\": ads_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"promo\": promo_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"weather\": weather_payload.get(\"source\"),\n        },\n        \"incrementality_design\": incrementality_design,\n    }\n"
}

import LakeWriter\n\nfrom .base import BaseIngestor, IngestionSummary, iso\n\nDEFAULT_DAYS_LOOKBACK = 90\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass AdsIngestor(BaseIngestor):\n    meta_connector: MetaAdsConnector | None  meta = None\n    google = None\n\n    meta_fixture = os.getenv(\"META_INSIGHTS_FIXTURE\")\n    if meta_fixture:\n        meta = MetaFixtureConnector(Path(meta_fixture))\n    else:\n        meta_access_token = os.getenv(\"META_ACCESS_TOKEN\")\n        meta_app_id = os.getenv(\"META_APP_ID\")\n        meta_app_secret = os.getenv(\"META_APP_SECRET\")\n        if meta_access_token and refresh_token = os.getenv(\"GOOGLEADS_REFRESH_TOKEN\")\n        client_id = os.getenv(\"GOOGLEADS_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID\")\n        client_secret = os.getenv(\"GOOGLEADS_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET\")\n        if google = GoogleAdsConnector(google_config)\n\n    return AdsIngestor(writer=writer, meta_connector=meta, google_connector=google)\n\n\nclass MetaFixtureConnector:\n    name = \"meta_ads_fixture\"\n\n {
  "path": "shared/libs/storage/lake.py",
  "content": "from __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any, Mapping, Sequence\n\nimport polars as pl\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass LakeWriter:\n    root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/raw\")\n\n    def __post_init__(self) -> None:\n        self.root = Path(self.root)\n        self.root.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n\n    def write_records(self, dataset: str, records: Sequence[Mapping[str, Any]]) -> Path:\n        \"\"\"Persist records to Parquet under storage/lake/raw/<dataset>/timestamp.parquet.\n\n        This is a convenience shim for the prototype: downstream consumers can read\n        the latest Parquet file for a dataset. In production we may evolve to Delta Lake\n        or Iceberg—but the API stays similar.\n        \"\"\"\n\n        if not records:\n            # Create an empty frame with no rows to keep pipeline consistent.\n            frame = pl.DataFrame([])\n        else:\n            frame = pl.DataFrame(records)\n\n        dataset_dir = self.root / dataset\n        dataset_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        timestamp = datetime.utcnow().isoformat().replace(\":\", \"-\")\n        path = dataset_dir / f\"{timestamp}.parquet\"\n        frame.write_parquet(path, compression=\"zstd\")\n        return path\n\n    def latest(self, dataset: str) -> Path | None:\n        dataset_dir = self.root / dataset\n        if not dataset_dir.exists():\n            return None\n        newest_path: Path | None = None\n        newest_mtime = float(\"-inf\")\n        for candidate in dataset_dir.glob(\"*.parquet\"):\n            try:\n                mtime = candidate.stat().st_mtime\n            except FileNotFoundError:\n                continue\n            if mtime > newest_mtime:\n                newest_mtime = mtime\n                newest_path = candidate\n        return newest_path\n\n\ndef read_parquet(path: Path) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    return pl.read_parquet(path)\n"
}

}

{
  "path": "apps/allocator/stress.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Stress testing utilities for the allocator.\n\nThe module provides deterministic stress scenarios that probe guardrails,\nquantile handling, and regret under mis-specified response curves.  All logic\nis pure Python so the suite can run in CI without SciPy.\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass, field\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, List, Sequence, Tuple\n\nimport math\n\nfrom apps.allocator.heuristics import AllocationInput, AllocationResult, Guardrails, allocate\n\n\nCurvePoint = Tuple[float, float]\n\n\ndef _build_curve(points: Sequence[Dict[str, float]]) -> List[CurvePoint]:\n    \"\"\"Normalise curve points to monotonically increasing (spend, revenue).\"\"\"\n    cleaned: List[CurvePoint] = []\n    for entry in points:\n        spend = float(entry.get(\"spend\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n        if spend < 0:\n            continue\n        revenue = float(\n            entry.get(\n                \"revenue\",\n                (entry.get(\"roas\") or 0.0) * spend,\n            )\n        )\n        cleaned.append((spend, revenue))\n    cleaned.sort(key=lambda pair: pair[0])\n    if cleaned and cleaned[0][0] > 0:\n        cleaned.insert(0, (0.0, 0.0))\n    if not cleaned:\n        cleaned.append((0.0, 0.0))\n    return cleaned\n\n\ndef _revenue_from_curve(curve: Sequence[CurvePoint], spend: float) -> float:\n    \"\"\"Piecewise linear interpolation over the curve.\"\"\"\n    if not curve:\n        return 0.0\n    if spend <= curve[0][0]:\n        baseline_spend, baseline_rev = curve[0]\n        if baseline_spend <= 0:\n            return baseline_rev\n        return (baseline_rev / baseline_spend) * spend\n    for idx in range(1, len(curve)):\n        prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[idx - 1]\n        curr_spend, curr_rev = curve[idx]\n        if spend <= curr_spend:\n            span = curr_spend - prev_spend\n            if span <= 0:\n                return curr_rev\n            weight = (spend - prev_spend) / span\n            return prev_rev + weight * (curr_rev - prev_rev)\n    last_spend, last_rev = curve[-1]\n    if len(curve) == 1:\n        return last_rev\n    prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[-2]\n    slope = 0.0\n    if last_spend != prev_spend:\n        slope = (last_rev - prev_rev) / (last_spend - prev_spend)\n    elif last_spend:\n        slope = last_rev / last_spend\n    return last_rev + slope * (spend - last_spend)\n\n\ndef _compute_profit(spends: Dict[str, float], curves: Dict[str, Sequence[CurvePoint]]) -> Tuple[float, Dict[str, float]]:\n    revenues: Dict[str, float] = {}\n    for cell, spend in spends.items():\n        curve = curves.get(cell, [(0.0, 0.0)])\n        revenues[cell] = _revenue_from_curve(curve, spend)\n    total_revenue = sum(revenues.values())\n    profit = total_revenue - sum(spends.values())\n    return profit, revenues\n\n\ndef _solve_oracle(\n    cells: Sequence[str],\n    total_budget: float,\n    guardrails: Guardrails,\n    curves: Dict[str, Sequence[CurvePoint]],\n) -> Tuple[Dict[str, float], float]:\n    \"\"\"Greedy marginal allocation to approximate the optimal profit.\"\"\"\n    if not cells:\n        return {}, 0.0\n\n    tol = 1e-6\n    min_spend = guardrails.min_spend\n    max_spend = guardrails.max_spend\n\n    spends: Dict[str, float] = {cell: min_spend for cell in cells}\n    total_min = min_spend * len(cells)\n    if total_min > total_budget + tol and total_min > 0:\n        scale = total_budget / total_min\n        for cell in cells:\n            spends[cell] = min_spend * scale\n\n    remaining = max(total_budget - sum(spends.values()), 0.0)\n\n    def segment_slope(cell: str, spend: float) -> Tuple[float, float]:\n        curve = curves[cell]\n        if spend >= max_spend - tol:\n            return 0.0, 0.0\n\n        prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[0]\n        for idx in range(1, len(curve)):\n            curr_spend, curr_rev = curve[idx]\n            if spend < curr_spend:\n                start_spend = max(spend, prev_spend)\n                span = curr_spend - prev_spend\n                if span <= tol:\n                    prev_spend, prev_rev = curr_spend, curr_rev\n                    continue\n                if start_spend <= prev_spend + tol:\n                    start_rev = prev_rev\n                else:\n                    ratio = (start_spend - prev_spend) / span\n                    start_rev = prev_rev + ratio * (curr_rev - prev_rev)\n                available = max(0.0, min(curr_spend, max_spend) - spend)\n                slope = 0.0\n                denom = curr_spend - start_spend\n                if denom > tol:\n                    slope = (curr_rev - start_rev) / denom\n                return slope, available\n            prev_spend, prev_rev = curr_spend, curr_rev\n\n        last_spend, last_rev = curve[-1]\n        if len(curve) > 1:\n            prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[-2]\n        slope = 0.0\n        if last_spend != prev_spend:\n            slope = (last_rev - prev_rev) / (last_spend - prev_spend)\n        elif last_spend > tol:\n            slope = last_rev / last_spend\n        return slope, max(0.0, max_spend - spend)\n\n    while remaining > tol:\n        best_cell = None\n        best_slope = -math.inf\n        best_capacity = 0.0\n        for cell in cells:\n            spend = spends[cell]\n            if spend >= max_spend - tol:\n                continue\n            slope, capacity = segment_slope(cell, spend)\n            if capacity <= tol:\n                continue\n            if slope > best_slope + 1e-9:\n                best_cell = cell\n                best_slope = slope\n                best_capacity = capacity\n\n        if best_cell is None or best_slope <= 0.0:\n            break\n\n        delta = min(remaining, best_capacity)\n        spends[best_cell] += delta\n        remaining -= delta\n\n    if remaining > tol:\n        # Distribute any flat, zero-slope remainder without violating caps.\n        while remaining > tol:\n            progress = False\n            for cell in cells:\n                capacity = max(0.0, max_spend - spends[cell])\n                if capacity <= tol:\n                    continue\n                delta = min(capacity, remaining)\n                if delta <= tol:\n                    continue\n                spends[cell] += delta\n                remaining -= delta\n                progress = True\n                if remaining <= tol:\n                    break\n            if not progress:\n                break\n\n    profit, _ = _compute_profit(spends, curves)\n    return spends, profit\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass StressTestConfig:\n    name: str\n    cells: Sequence[str]\n    total_budget: float\n    expected_roas: Dict[str, float]\n    actual_roi_curves: Dict[str, Sequence[Dict[str, float]]]\n    current_spend: Dict[str, float]\n    guardrails: Guardrails\n    quantile_factors: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)\n    context_tags: Sequence[str] = field(default_factory=list)\n    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)\n\n    def cleaned_curves(self) -> Dict[str, List[CurvePoint]]:\n        return {cell: _build_curve(self.actual_roi_curves.get(cell, [])) for cell in self.cells}\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass StressTestResult:\n    name: str\n    allocation: AllocationResult\n    actual_profit: float\n    oracle_profit: float\n    regret: float\n    regret_pct: float\n    revenues: Dict[str, float]\n    metadata: Dict[str, Any]\n\n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        payload = {\n            \"name\": self.name,\n            \"actual_profit\": self.actual_profit,\n            \"oracle_profit\": self.oracle_profit,\n            \"regret\": self.regret,\n            \"regret_pct\": self.regret_pct,\n            \"revenues\": self.revenues,\n            \"allocation\": {\n                \"spends\": self.allocation.spends,\n                \"profit\": self.allocation.profit,\n                \"diagnostics\": self.allocation.diagnostics,\n            },\n        }\n        if self.metadata:\n            payload[\"metadata\"] = self.metadata\n        return payload\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass StressSuiteReport:\n    results: List[StressTestResult]\n\n    @property\n    def worst_regret(self) -> float:\n        return max((result.regret for result in self.results), default=0.0)\n\n    @property\n    def worst_regret_pct(self) -> float:\n        return max((result.regret_pct for result in self.results), default=0.0)\n\n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        return {\n            \"results\": [result.to_dict() for result in self.results],\n            \"worst_regret\": self.worst_regret,\n            \"worst_regret_pct\": self.worst_regret_pct,\n        }\n\n\ndef run_stress_test(config: StressTestConfig) -> StressTestResult:\n    curves = config.cleaned_curves()\n    context_tags = list(config.context_tags)\n    if \"history.short\" not in context_tags:\n        context_tags.append(\"history.short\")\n\n    allocation_input = AllocationInput(\n        cells=list(config.cells),\n        total_budget=config.total_budget,\n        current_spend=dict(config.current_spend),\n        expected_roas=dict(config.expected_roas),\n        roi_curves={cell: [dict(point) for point in config.actual_roi_curves.get(cell, [])] for cell in config.cells},\n        guardrails=config.guardrails,\n        context_tags=context_tags,\n        quantile_factors=dict(config.quantile_factors),\n    )\n    allocation = allocate(allocation_input)\n\n    actual_profit, revenues = _compute_profit(allocation.spends, curves)\n\n    oracle_spends, oracle_profit = _solve_oracle(\n        cells=list(config.cells),\n        total_budget=config.total_budget,\n        guardrails=config.guardrails,\n        curves=curves,\n    )\n\n    regret = max(oracle_profit - actual_profit, 0.0)\n    regret_pct = 0.0\n    if abs(oracle_profit) > 1e-6:\n        regret_pct = regret / abs(oracle_profit)\n\n    return StressTestResult(\n        name=config.name,\n        allocation=allocation,\n        actual_profit=float(actual_profit),\n        oracle_profit=float(oracle_profit),\n        regret=float(regret),\n        regret_pct=float(regret_pct),\n        revenues=revenues,\n        metadata=dict(config.metadata),\n    )\n\n\ndef default_stress_suite() -> StressSuiteReport:\n    base_guardrails = Guardrails(min_spend=50.0, max_spend=300.0, roas_floor=1.2, learning_cap=0.4)\n\n    moderate_curve = [\n        {\"spend\": 50.0, \"revenue\": 80.0},\n        {\"spend\": 150.0, \"revenue\": 220.0},\n        {\"spend\": 300.0, \"revenue\": 430.0},\n    ]\n    steep_curve = [\n        {\"spend\": 50.0, \"revenue\": 120.0},\n        {\"spend\": 150.0, \"revenue\": 280.0},\n        {\"spend\": 300.0, \"revenue\": 500.0},\n    ]\n    saturating_curve = [\n        {\"spend\": 50.0, \"revenue\": 100.0},\n        {\"spend\": 150.0, \"revenue\": 210.0},\n        {\"spend\": 300.0, \"revenue\": 360.0},\n    ]\n\n    scenarios = [\n        StressTestConfig(\n            name=\"balanced-curve\",\n            cells=(\"meta\", \"google\"),\n            total_budget=300.0,\n            current_spend={\"meta\": 120.0, \"google\": 120.0},\n            expected_roas={\"meta\": 2.4, \"google\": 2.0},\n            actual_roi_curves={\"meta\": steep_curve, \"google\": moderate_curve},\n            guardrails=base_guardrails,\n            metadata={\"focus\": \"baseline alignment\"},\n        ),\n engineers can follow the flow:\n\n1. page through Shopify REST endpoints with `fetch`\n2. normalise records into small dicts\n3. persist them via `LakeWriter`\n4. return a simple `IngestionSummary`\n\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nimport os\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, List, Mapping\n\nfrom shared.libs.connectors import ShopifyConfig, ShopifyConnector\nfrom shared.libs.storage.lake import LakeWriter\nfrom shared.libs.storage.state import JsonStateStore\nfrom shared.validation.schemas import validate_shopify_orders, validate_shopify_products\n\nfrom .base import BaseIngestor, IngestionSummary, iso\nfrom .geocoding import Geocoder, enrich_order_with_geo\n\nDEFAULT_PAGE_LIMIT = 250\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass ShopifyIngestor(BaseIngestor):\n    connector: ShopifyConnector\n    geocoder: Geocoder | None = None\n    state_store: JsonStateStore | None = None\n\n    async def ingest_orders(\n        self,\n        tenant_id: str,\n        start_date: datetime,\n        end_date: datetime,\n        status: str = \"any\",\n    ) -> IngestionSummary:\n        params = {\n            \"status\": status,\n            \"limit\": DEFAULT_PAGE_LIMIT,\n            \"order\": \"updated_at asc\",\n            \"created_at_min\": iso(start_date),\n            \"created_at_max\": iso(end_date),\n        }\n\n        state_key = f\"{tenant_id}_orders\"\n        state = self.state_store.load(\"shopify\", state_key) if self.state_store else {}\n        since = state.get(\"updated_at_min\")\n        if since:\n            params[\"updated_at_min\"] = since\n\n        orders = await self._collect_rest(\"orders\", params=params)\n        geocoder = self.geocoder or Geocoder()\n        enriched = [enrich_order_with_geo(order, geocoder) for order in orders]\n        rows = [self._normalise_order(tenant_id, order) for order in enriched]\n        if rows:\n            validate_shopify_orders(rows)\n        geocoded_count = sum(1 for row in rows if row.get(\"ship_geohash\"))\n        geocoded_ratio = geocoded_count / len(rows) if rows else 0.0\n        summary = self._write_records(\n            dataset=f\"{tenant_id}_shopify_orders\",\n            rows=rows,\n            source=\"shopify_api\",\n            metadata={\n                \"geocoded_count\": geocoded_count,\n                \"geocoded_ratio\": geocoded_ratio,\n            },\n        )\n        if rows and self.state_store:\n            latest_updated = max((order.get(\"updated_at\") for order in orders if order.get(\"updated_at\")), default=None)\n            if latest_updated:\n                self.state_store.save(\n                    \"shopify\",\n                    state_key,\n                    {\n                        \"updated_at_min\": latest_updated,\n                        \"last_run_at\": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n                        \"row_count\": summary.row_count,\n                    },\n                )\n        return summary\n\n    async def ingest_products(self, tenant_id: str) -> IngestionSummary:\n        params = {\"limit\": DEFAULT_PAGE_LIMIT}\n        products = await self._collect_rest(\"products\", params=params)\n        rows = [self._normalise_product(tenant_id, product) for product in products]\n        if rows:\n            validate_shopify_products(rows)\n        return self._write_records(\n            dataset=f\"{tenant_id}_shopify_products\", rows=rows, source=\"shopify_api\"\n        )\n\n    async def _collect_rest(self, resource: str, params: Dict[str, Any]) -> List[Mapping[str, Any]]:\n        \"\"\"Iterate through Shopify REST pagination until there are no more pages.\"\"\"\n\n        cursor = None\n        results: List[Mapping[str, Any]] = []\n        base_params = params.copy()\n        while True:\n            payload, cursor = await self.connector.fetch_page(resource, params=base_params, cursor=cursor)\n            items = ShopifyConnector._extract_items(resource, payload)\n            if not items:\n                break\n            results.extend(items)\n            if not cursor:\n                break\n        return results\n\n    def _normalise_order(self, tenant_id: str, order: Mapping[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        shipping = order.get(\"shipping_address\") or {}\n        order_id = self._coerce_str(order.get(\"id\"))\n        currency = self._coerce_str(order.get(\"currency\"))\n        created_at = self._coerce_str(order.get(\"created_at\"))\n        return {\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"order_id\": order_id or \"\",\n            \"name\": self._coerce_str(order.get(\"name\")),\n            \"created_at\": created_at or \"\",\n            \"currency\": currency or \"\",\n            \"total_price\": float(order.get(\"total_price\") or 0),\n            \"subtotal_price\": float(order.get(\"subtotal_price\") or 0),\n            \"total_tax\": float(order.get(\"total_tax\") or 0),\n            \"total_discounts\": float(order.get(\"total_discounts\") or 0),\n            \"shipping_postal_code\": self._coerce_str(\n                shipping.get(\"zip\") or shipping.get(\"postal_code\")\n            ),\n            \"shipping_country\": self._coerce_str(\n                shipping.get(\"country_code\") or shipping.get(\"country\")\n            ),\n            \"ship_latitude\": order.get(\"ship_latitude\"),\n            \"ship_longitude\": order.get(\"ship_longitude\"),\n            \"ship_geohash\": order.get(\"ship_geohash\"),\n        }\n\n    def _normalise_product(self, tenant_id: str, product: Mapping[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        return {\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"product_id\": self._coerce_str(product.get(\"id\")) or \"\",\n            \"title\": self._coerce_str(product.get(\"title\")),\n            \"product_type\": self._coerce_str(product.get(\"product_type\")),\n            \"vendor\": self._coerce_str(product.get(\"vendor\")),\n            \"created_at\": self._coerce_str(product.get(\"created_at\")),\n            \"updated_at\": self._coerce_str(product.get(\"updated_at\")),\n        }\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _coerce_str(value: Any) -> str | None:\n        if value is None:\n            return None\n        text = str(value).strip()\n        return text or None\n\n\ndef build_shopify_ingestor_from_env(\n    lake_root: str,\n    *,\n    state_root: str | os.PathLike[str] | None = None,\n) -> ShopifyIngestor | None:\n    \"\"\"Convenience factory that returns an ingestor when env vars are present.\"\"\"\n\n    shop_domain = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_SHOP_DOMAIN\")\n    access_token = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_ACCESS_TOKEN\")\n    if not shop_domain or not access_token:\n        return None\n    api_version = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_API_VERSION\", \"2024-04\")\n    client_id = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_CLIENT_ID\")\n    client_secret = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_CLIENT_SECRET\")\n    refresh_token = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_REFRESH_TOKEN\")\n    config = ShopifyConfig(\n        shop_domain=shop_domain,\n        access_token=access_token,\n        api_version=api_version,\n        client_id=client_id,\n        client_secret=client_secret,\n        refresh_token=refresh_token,\n    )\n    state_store = JsonStateStore(root=state_root) if state_root else JsonStateStore()\n    return ShopifyIngestor(\n        connector=ShopifyConnector(config),\n        writer=LakeWriter(root=lake_root),\n        state_store=state_store,\n    )\n"
}
